reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Mad No ! Compassionate And Loving , Yes !
reviews.reviewText: What started as an Obligation , A Marriage of Convenience, and A Promise to his Best Friend as he lay dying on the battle field begins a very Rocky Journey ! He might have been a Duke, but that did not matter to the Ton on how he was treated. His reputation was tainted with lies about him . Monster, Beast, Mad were just a few taunting words and tales about him . She wanted nothing to do with him. Not knowing him and forced into a a marriage she only believed the rumors . So a Marriage begins putting up the front of The Happy Couple ! Certainly not though ! How could it be ? Never getting the chance to know one another ? Believing Lies ? People scaring her ? Interference all around ! An Emotional Rollercoaster !Annette Arkenson lived with her Uncle the Viscount of Salisbury and her Cousin William. Her Uncle not being well wanted her married to someone would take care of her now that her Brother was dead.Magnas Harper the Duke of Harrison had been in the Military. That is where he met Annette’s Brother. They were best friends . He had promised him he would take care of his sister. Not only did he have to marry her he had to deal with the Ton and there cruelty towards him. Also taking car of his sick Mother . Was he ever to have so sense of peace ?Annette and Magnas were brought together by the Betrothal. Neither really happy about the prospect. He out of duty. She trying every way to get out of it . Even trying to compromise herself . A sudden marriage and a lonely existence . Nothing happy , Fake , until little by little things begin to change !This Emotional Tale Touches your Heart . So much pain he goes through unnecessarily . A quick marriage. He trying to please everyone. Most of all the way they finally build their relationship ! The beauty in it is overwhelming with Tenderness, Compassion and Love ! Beautifully Told and a Wonderful Read !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I almost gave this 3 stars because I found the numerous typos and errors beyond distracting
reviews.reviewText: I found the character of Annette to be very inconsistent, which was a real disappointment. She starts out strong and fierce in her emotions and actions, even if they are irrational and prejudiced. However, later in the story when she has firsthand knowledge, she not only does not act on it, she becomes weak and impotent. Annette believed and acted on gossip more forcefully than she believed and acted on things she experienced personally.There was also what I consider to be too much internal thinking by Annette which is actually not only repetitive, but also slows down the story. Even worse, she never actually follows through on any of her thoughts, but just keeps debating them over and over again. The only reason I gave the book this many stars is because of the dramatic scene near the end of the book that was not only very compelling, but also very satisfying.The large number of typos were distracting and are part of the reason for my rating. But they are overshadowed by my distaste for the manipulative way that readers are forced to give their email information. It used to be that to read the extended epilogues you had to click and give your contact information (also requiring internet access), but now authors are also adding introductory chapters that also require the same thing. It makes me angry that they manipulate readers like that, rather than just including the prequel chapters and extended epilogues as part of the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Don’t Believe The Gossip
reviews.reviewText: Magnus held his best friend in his arms on the battlefield and promised him that he would follow his dying words to take care of and marry his sister when he returned from the war. Annette was shocked when her Uncle informed her that she would be marrying Magnus. Now if Magnus was not labeled as the Mad Duke maybe she would have not been concerned but rumors had it that he had beaten his fiancé and was not to be trusted to be a loving, caring person. This sets the backdrop for how they would interact with each other and how Magnus would have to show Annette who he really was as a person and not the individual that the gossip had labeled him. We have a number of shocking events, both in what actually forces them to marry and later on when Annette has finally come to terms of who Magnus really is as a person.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This story has a good feel. Some of the language felt a little stilted which made it more difficult to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love has a way of finding us.
reviews.reviewText: Magnus and Annette are to marry. He promised her brother before he died that he would marry her. She doesn't want to marry him he is known to be mad and cruel. She causes a scandal that ensures they marry and quickly. After the marriage she is confused he doesn't seem to be the way the ton says he is. Soon they fall in love but there are some trying to break them apart. Lucky for them their love is too strong.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mad? Or Not Mad?
reviews.reviewText: Ava MacAdams has written a really slow burn with " The Mad Duke Takes a Bride." The reader is introduced to the main characters early in the book. The Duke is introduced on the battlefield when his good friend lies dying and asks that his friend marry his sister after his death.Lady Annette is met on her way to a house party. Her uncle informs her that he has arranged her marriage to the duke and she is to meet him for the first time at the house party.They meet and then the action begins. Neither one of them is anxious to mary.There are some surprises along the way and I was impressed how the author let her characters grow.I give it 4 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved the story and the plot. Was really great getting to know the characters.I hated what William turned out to be. I love all your books. Thank you for another good book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An enjoyable tale that made the pages turn. I was happy to have read this story and thought it was a compelling journey to the ending. An Ave MacAdams title is always something to look forward to and I look forward to the next.

Annette and Magnus marry over a promise to her deceased brother Thomas. With lots of scheming behind their backs, the path to happiness is full of twists and turns. The ton is truly horrible with their gossiping judgemental ways.
Avevo bisogno di leggere qualcosa di non impegnativo ma questo è esageratamente non impegnativo. Non lo consiglio

Marcus and Annette's story would be awful if it weren't for the wonderful protagonists and the messages it contains: nobody can relate to what fighting in a war and watching a friend die does to your mind and soul, but society is fast condemning people who do not fit into their patterns, unfortunately not much has changed about that until today. Being forced into a marriage of convenience also doesn't guarantee for a happy life, so I was very satiesfied when schemers trying to add to the couple's strains didn't succeed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Duke Marcus was thought to be cruel and mad. He had been a soldier and had been with his best friend, Thomas, when he had died from his injuries. As he was dying, Thomas, made Marcus swear that he would marry his sister, Annette, and look after her. When Marcus returned from the war, Annette's uncle and Marcus' mother were keen to arrange his marriage to Annette, despite the fact that Annette knew nothing about it until it was agreed.The story follows Annette and Marcus and explores how their misunderstandings begin to turn into affection. There are others who try to convince Annette that Marcus is mad and dangerous but she sees another side to him. When Annette is injured by her cousin, William, Marcus is willing to risk his reputation by challenging William to tell the truth about whether or not Marcus is really mad and who had hurt Annette. Another is involved in the deception and when all is revealed it is clear that Marcus is not the villain he is made out to be. Will Annette and Marcus finally be able to be fully welcomed ino society again? Read on and enjoy this well-written book.
